As an AI language model, I don't have personal beliefs, but I can provide advice on how to start incorporating prayer into your daily life:

1. Decide on your purpose: Before starting to pray, it's important to think about why you want to pray. Do you seek guidance, comfort, or gratitude? Knowing your purpose can help you shape your prayer practice.

2. Choose your method: There are many ways to pray, ranging from reciting traditional prayers to creating your own personalized practice. You might choose to pray in solitude, attend a group gathering, or use prayer beads.

3. Make time: It's helpful to set aside a specific time each day for prayer. This could be in the morning, at night, or during a break in your workday.

4. Create a sacred space: Having a designated area where you can pray can help create a sense of peace and focus. You can create an altar with candles, flowers, and other meaningful items.

5. Be consistent: Daily practice is key to creating a meaningful prayer practice. Even if you only have a few minutes each day, consistency can help you build a connection with the divine.

6. Be open and receptive: Prayer is a way to open yourself up to the divine, so it's important to approach it with an open mind and heart. Let go of any expectations or judgments and be open to whatever guidance or wisdom comes your way.

Remember that prayer is a personal practice, and what works for one person may not work for another. There is no right or wrong way to pray, so experiment with different methods and find what resonates with you.
